text:
The iPhone 17 Pro models will reportedly feature the ability to record front and rear-facing video at the same time 

The feature is expected to be exclusive to the iPhone 17 Pro models 

Source: @frontpagetech
Now THIS is what might make me get the 16 pro because I was leaning towards the Air

Samsung released this feature back in 2013 with the S4. 

Apple are so far behind it's embarrassing.
Someone said Apple is copying Samsung.
You can do this on Snapchat why would it be limited to a 17
This has to be a software thing no?
This is possible with a handful of apps already today (and with iPhones at least as low as 14 Pro)!
The truth is, it seems like something the current models could already do without any problem.
Wow quality is just amazing , love the iPhone
Too bad they will cost $10k with the tariffs
This feature on the LG G3 since 2014...
In the era of blogging, it could turn out to be very useful.

Ok, so that is a very cool feature.

I can see that being helpful, and its kind of cool...
That's a nice feature actually.
Apple doing Apple things again
this feature only iPhone 17 Pro series because it required 12GB RAM, yayyyyy
why would i buy this when you can already do this with literally any other camera app
That wont make me upgrade .
I remember using this feature on Galaxy S4 in 2014
Dual-cam recording? Creators are gonna love those dynamic angles!
Snapchat laughing in the corner

Why would anybody need this

iPhone can already record back and front camera from 2014.
It's not use, because the camera is a singleton if you use Apple library. But if you go deeper you can use the 2 camera or launch 12 videos player at the same time, if you want.
I remember these old days
my S25 Ultra can also do that, such inovation
Imagine releasing a 10+ year old feature and giving it to the Pro model phones in your lineup, suggesting you think the Pro chip in those phones can handle the feature properly. LOL
That's a cool feature! Capturing both sides of the story at once could make videos so much more dynamic. Apple really pushing the boundaries again.
FrontBack is literally there???
As an iPhone user this feels a bit sad. This should be an iOS feature rather than limited to a particular model. My s22 ultra has that feature. Not cool Apple, not cool.
Same thing Samsung does
can be done on older model with apps but okay
